modules.description: This module handles file input/output operations, statistical calculations, and list manipulations. It works with strings, float lists, and generic lists for tasks like splitting, filtering, and processing lines from files. Concrete use cases include reading and writing float data from files, computing standard deviation, executing shell commands, performing train/test splits on datasets, and generating cross-validation folds.

This module implements Partial Least Squares (PLS) regression with operations to optimize model parameters, train a model, and make predictions. It works with CSV files containing numerical data in space-separated format, where the first column is the target variable and the remaining columns are features. The module supports cross-validation during optimization, model training with a specified number of components, and prediction either in-memory or directly to a file.

This module implements Partial Least Squares regression with functions to optimize model parameters, perform cross-validation, and generate predictions on numerical data from CSV files. It operates on space-separated files where the first column is the target variable and the rest are features, supporting in-memory prediction and file output. The companion utility module handles file I/O, statistical computations like standard deviation, dataset splitting, and shell command execution.
